title: String Symphony
story: Strings are sequences of characters - letters, numbers, symbols. They're perfect for working with text! You can combine strings, repeat them, and extract parts. Let's explore the power of string manipulation.
instructions: Create a variable `first_name` with value "Ada" and `last_name` with value "Lovelace". Create a `full_name` by combining them with a space between. Create a `greeting` that says "Hello, " followed by the full name. Print both full_name and greeting.
solutionHidden:
first_name = "Ada"
last_name = "Lovelace"
full_name = first_name + " " + last_name
greeting = "Hello, " + full_name
print(full_name)
print(greeting)

tests.expectedBehavior: full_name must combine first and last name with space
greeting must start with 'Hello, ' followed by full_name

hints.text: Use the + operator to concatenate (combine) strings together
Don't forget to add a space between first and last name: " "
full_name = first_name + " " + last_name, then greeting = "Hello, " + full_name
